title: Vacaay
subtitle: Vacation Planner & Social Media App
description: Vacaay is a vacation planner and social media app that allows users to plan their vacations, share their experiences, and connect with other travelers. Users can create a profile, search for destinations, create a travel itinerary, and share their experiences with friends and family. The app also includes a social media feed where users can post photos, videos, and updates about their trips. Vacaay is built with React, Next.js, and PostgreSQL.

title: Avatar Metal Works
subtitle: Workflow & Inventory Management System
description: Avatar Metal Works is a workflow and inventory management system for a metal fabrication company. The system allows employees to create and manage work orders, track inventory, and generate reports. Employees can also view detailed information about each work order, including the status, due date, and assigned employees. The system is built with React, Next.js, and PostgreSQL.

title: Jobly
subtitle: Company Detailing Web App
description: Jobly is a company detailing and job application website. Wanna see a list of companies, a particular company, or a company's employees? Our backend API's got you covered. It'll fetch all the data you need from our database while React will render it with stunning visual detail. The website comes stocked with authentication, authorization across the board, and several account features like profile-editing. Looking for a specific type of company or job? Don't worry, we've got a search bar for when you really wanna narrow things down.

title: Warbler
subtitle: Dynamic Social Media App
description: Warbler is a fully backend, dynamic social media application with fully-integrated authentication and authorization. This, along with the general UI is powered by a Python, Flask, and SQLAlchemy backend. It leverages a relational PostgreSQL database to facilitate "Likes", "Follows", and "Followers". And of course this is all automatically stored on the user's profile page. That way, you can brag about your first 10 followers like I did back in the MySpace days. Other features include a profile-edit page (authorization required), an intelligently populated feed, and of course, the ability to write posts yourself.
